comments.text: Being lucky u'ill get a ride to Santiago de los Caballeros within a few minutes.

An amazing place to get rides in the direction of Nagua, Cotuí, Maimón or Bonao. There's this thing that slows down cars so you can just stan by and wait. Also many employees from Barrick (the gold mine) are hitchhiking there to get from job. U can also buy fresh fruit here

There's this thing for slowing cars, where everyone slows down and see you. Smile or scream a place where you wanna go and add "bola". Whether its Constanza, Bonao or Jarabacoa, u'ill get the hike soon

A great place to get a cars and trucks out of Constanza, directly to Jarabacoa or the main highway (Bonao, Piedra Blanca and so). If you look around the main street and walk a but, you will find the thing for slowing down the cars on a ground. Stand there and just ask people, it will work very very fast

Pretty good place to get a ride to both directions. Just go on the highway and screem the name of the place where you want to go, no matter if its Punta Cana or Boca Chica (just keep in mind the right direction :Dd). No one will arrest you, this is DR

You can get the car to Samaná within just a few seconds. Since this is one of the most tourist-active destinations in DR, it is possible that a person asks you for money in the car. The vast majority of them will not tho

There are not so many cars, but if u catch one, its usually going to Santo Domingo. Amazing spot if you need to the capital. Also if you don't speak spanish, the stuff on that gas station will ask people for you and find you the hike.
There is the thing for slowing down cars and everyone from there goes to Constanza. You can go even with trucks, the view on the way is AMAZING
Literally everyone from here goes to Cotuí or even further to Nagua or San Francisco
A amazing spot for getting rides to Maimón, Cotuí and possibly even Nagua
A great spot for getting hikes out of Maimón de Bonao

Great for getting cars or camions to Santo Domingo, possibly Samaná. Considering many possible directions, just ask the people on the gass station where they're going. We hitchhiked to the hardest direction possible here which is Santiago, asked few people and got a direct hike

A bit harder but definitelly the best place to get a car or truck to the Salto de Limón watefrall, which is absolutelly stunning. You can go to the gas station and ask people there or just wait for those who are passing around and both will work

You will possibly wait a bit cause the cars arw going too fast there and there is nothing to slow them down, so they cant even notice you very well. Try to show up as much as possible to them. When a slower car passes, you get the hike easilly to Pimethel or even further to the direction of Nagua

A great spot for getting the cars and trucks to San José de Ocoa. The conditions of the road are still very very tuff tho, so prepare yourself and if you don't love adventure, don't go on storrage space with trucks here
Too many cars but its hard to get a ride without asking. If u ask people, you can easilly get a ride to any place on the main highway, including the capital of Santo Domingo.
